incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the errors impacting multiple Twilio services issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that they're related to the existing StatusPage post at https://status.twilio.com/incidents/vzmt0w4c8xy5. Please continue to look for additional updates in that active post.

We are currently investigating errors, impacting multiple Twilio services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio or Twilio SendGrid account and submit a support ticket.

incidents.name: 500 Errors for Some Twilio Websites

incident_updates.body: 500 errors have been resolved and Twilio websites are operating normally at this time.
Twilio Websites are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing our investigation and have discovered that 500 errors for some Twilio Websites is impacting multiple regions. Our engineers are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: 504s Errors in the Twilio Console

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Console was degraded, and our engineers continue to investigate the exact impact times. During this period of time, customers were intermittently unable to complete console interactions and received 504s on the Twilio Console. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of this retroactive issue with 2FA. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with the Twilio Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Unable to Login into Flex

incident_updates.body:
We’re seeing recovery in intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account. Flex insights is now confirmed not to be impacted by this incident, so we’re making a correction regarding customer impact. As a workaround, we suggest clearing out cache data by following these steps:

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click “Clear Data”

If the steps above don’t work, please try to use the browser’s incognito mode.

We’ll continue to monitor for service stability and we’ll provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We’re seeing recovery in intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account. Flex insights is now confirmed not to be impacted by this incident, so we’re making a correction regarding customer impact. As a workaround, we suggest clearing out cache data by following these steps:

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click “Clear Data”

If the steps above don’t work, please try to use the browser’s incognito mode.

We’ll continue to monitor for service stability and we’ll provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue investigating intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account and Flex insights. As a workaround, we suggest clearing out cache data by following these steps:

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click “Clear Data”

If the steps above don’t work, please try to use the browser’s incognito mode.

We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account and Flex insights. As a workaround, we suggest clearing out cache data by following these steps:

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click “Clear Data”

 We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account and Flex insights. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are investigating a service interruption with Flex. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with SMS delivery delays to Tigo Network in Colombia over a subset of short codes. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Intermittent Dequeue Call Drops Issues

incident_updates.body: Call drops and failures are operating normally at this time. Therefore, we're resolving this incident post.

We have identified the issue with call drops and failures, and have started to see recovery. Customers using the <Enqueue> instruction in their call flow may have experienced issues including call drops and failures to bridge calls. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating dequeue calls drop issues. Customers may experience calls dropped very shortly after connecting. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with dequeue calls. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Programmable Wireless API Returning Elevated HTTP 500 Error Rates

incident_updates.body: We have identified and redeployed the affected host. The issue has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We have identified and redeployed the affected host. We are seeing recovery from the API errors and are monitoring closely for any changes. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or sooner once more information becomes available.

We are experiencing elevated HTTP 500 error rates from the Commands API. The elevated error rates may result in loss of failed commands. Client software should retry sending the commands from their end. 

Also, there might be high latency when loading Programmable Wireless pages via Console. Our engineering team is actively investigating the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~5 % of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing network connectivity issue. This incident has been resolved.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 14:13 UTC, we observed ~5 % of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: TaskRouter affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio TaskRouter was degraded for 40 minutes between 3:50 and 4:30 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced an increase in timed out TaskRouter Reservations. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with TaskRouter being degraded on June 14th, 3:50 AM PT for about an hour. incidents.name: Twilio.com Contact Page Returning a 404 Error

incident_updates.body: The 404 errors have been resolved and the https://www.twilio.com/help/contact page is operating normally at this time.

The https://www.twilio.com/help/contact page is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors Impacting Multiple Twilio Services

incident_updates.body: All services impacted have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We continue to observe recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. We’re making a correction to our previous communications regarding Flex insights impact. After investigation, we could confirm that Flex Insights wasn’t impacted, but Flex Historical Insights. Thus, Historical data reports for Flex Historical Insights that are currently unavailable during the Twilio impacted services may take some time to be available. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. Historical data reports for Flex Historical Insights that are currently unavailable during the Twilio impacted services may take some time to be available. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team identified an issue with Flex Insights that is affecting users being unable to sign in to insights, and data being delayed for those that are already logged in. Customers may also experience issues updating existing functions and assets. Customers may see 500 errors when sign up for TOTP within their accounts. Furthermore, customers are unable to register for WhatsApp and the Authy Desktop App is unable to be dowloaded at the moment. Our engineers are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio console, and submit a support ticket. Customers may be unable to create support tickets via Sendgrid. Check SendGrid’s status page for more details.

Our engineering team identified an issue with Flex Insights that is affecting users being unable to sign in to insights, and data being delayed for those that are already logged in. Customers may experience issues updating existing assets. Customers may see 500 errors in the Twilio console, and not being able to sign up for TOTP. Our engineers are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio or Twilio SendGrid account and submit a support ticket.

We are experiencing an issue with the Flex Insights and Functions services. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating errors impacting multiple Twilio services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

If you're having issues to contact support. For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio or Twilio SendGrid account and submit a support ticket.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 17% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: The 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped has been resolved, and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

The 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at [22:10 UTC], we observed 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. After the initial drop we detected two additional session drops after the system has partially recovered. We are still missing ~17% of sessions. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Beginning at [22:10 UTC], we observed 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. We observe that some of the devices have recovered. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body: We have confirmed that OTP messages are being correctly processed, the problem persist with non OTP messages. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours (daily) or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incidents.name: Errors on some Twilio URLs

incident_updates.body: Some Twilio URLs were degraded for 6 days, 21 hours and 52 minutes between 12:47 on 06/05/2023 and 10:39 on 06/12/2023 Pacific Time. During this time, customer may face intermitted issues reaching some Twilio pages. The issue has now been resolved.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issues reaching some Twilio URLs.  Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
